main_definition: To have knowledge or information about a particular subject.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having accurate, up-to-date, and comprehensive knowledge about something.
meanings_and_examples.example: After attending several workshops on climate change, she became very well informed about the issue.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being aware of or receiving information that affects one's decisions or opinions.
meanings_and_examples.example: The doctor informed the patient about the risks and benefits of the surgery to help them make an informed decision.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Providing someone with relevant information so they can better understand a situation.
meanings_and_examples.example: The lawyer informed her client about all legal options available for their case.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being educated or knowledgeable in a particular area or subject.
meanings_and_examples.example: He is very well-informed on the latest technology trends due to his job in the tech industry.
